intro: Mollinedia krukovii, commonly known as the Krukovii's milkweed, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its showy, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant has hairy stems and leaves that are typically opposite in arrangement. It produces a milky sap, which is a common feature among members of its family. Mollinedia krukovii is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in moist, shaded environments.
